title: Guest Talks
description: In-depth lectures from leading researchers and guest lecturers on foundational and cutting-edge topics in complexity science. Followed by an extended Q&A session.

title: Nascent Research
description: A rapid-fire series inspired by Pecha Kucha. Presenters share emerging research in 10-minute talks, followed by 10 minutes of Q&A. Perfect for gathering feedback and sparking new collaborations.

title: Workshops
description: Hands-on sessions to learn new methods, tools, and skills related to complexity science. Check back for announcements.

title: Community Talks
description: Seminar-style talks by CGS participants and EPE network members, designed to showcase ongoing research and projects, share theoretical and methodological approaches, and stimulate critical discussion.

title: Complexity Narratives
description: An epistemologically-forward attempt at historically recontextualizing the ways in which our world systems have developed, and how we can better address their emergent challenges.
